org.codeandmagic.timeline
Class StaticEventIconRenderer

java.lang.Object
  org.codeandmagic.timeline.StaticEventIconRenderer
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventIconRenderer, TimelineViewAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
DynamicEventIconRenderer
public class StaticEventIconRenderer
extends java.lang.Object
implements EventIconRenderer, TimelineViewAware

Implementation of EventIconRenderer that draws an image for the event and optionally a text.
This class performs the actual rendering and also the collision detection.

Author:
cristi

Nested Class Summary
static interface StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat
          A StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat can be injected into a StaticEventIconRenderer to determine what label to draw next to the event icon;
static class StaticEventIconRenderer.NameEventLabelFormat
          An StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat that return the event name.
static class StaticEventIconRenderer.TimeAndNameEventLabelFormat
          Subclass of StaticEventIconRenderer.NameEventLabelFormat that in addition to the Event name, it also displays the date of the event

 void renderIcons(Canvas canvas, TimelineRenderingContext context)
          Renders the events visible in the current frame onto the Canvas of the TimelineView.
The TimelineRenderingContext provides the index of the first and last visible Events through the TimelineRenderingContext.getFirtEventIndex() and TimelineRenderingContext.getTimeline() methods.Then they can be extracted from TimelineRenderingContext.getTimeline() -> TimelineView.getEvents() -> Events.getEvents()
The the horizontal positioning of the events can be found in TimelineRenderingContext.getEventsX().

Determines if an event icon that is positioned at the given coordinates intersects the other point given by the other coordinates.

Returns:

renderIcons

public void renderIcons(Canvas canvas,
                        TimelineRenderingContext context)
Description copied from interface: EventIconRenderer
Renders the events visible in the current frame onto the Canvas of the TimelineView.
The TimelineRenderingContext provides the index of the first and last visible Events through the TimelineRenderingContext.getFirtEventIndex() and TimelineRenderingContext.getTimeline() methods.Then they can be extracted from TimelineRenderingContext.getTimeline() -> TimelineView.getEvents() -> Events.getEvents()
The the horizontal positioning of the events can be found in TimelineRenderingContext.getEventsX(). The vertical position can be found in TimelineRenderingContext.getEventsY()

Specified by:
renderIcons in interface EventIconRenderer
See Also:
TimelineRenderingContext.getFirtEventIndex(), TimelineRenderingContext.getLastEventIndex(), TimelineView.getEvents()

setIconHeight

setDefaultIconDrawable

public void setDefaultIconDrawable(int defaultIconId)
Sets the resource id of the icon to be used by this renderer. Set this to 0 if you want no image to be drawn.
NOTE: This needs to be consistent with setIconWidth(int) and setIconHeight(int).
NOTE: This needs to be set before TimelineViewAware#timelineViewContructed(org.codeandmagic.timeline.TimelineView) gets called.

Parameters:
defaultIconId -

getLabelFormat

public StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat getLabelFormat()

setLabelFormat

public void setLabelFormat(StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat labelFormat)
Sets the StaticEventIconRenderer.EventLabelFormat to use to render the label. Set this to null if you want no label to be drawn.

Parameters:
labelFormat -

getLabelLeft

public int getLabelLeft()

setLabelLeft

public void setLabelLeft(int labelHorizontalMargin)
Horizontal position of the label relative to the position of the event (left-top corner of the image).
Note that you need to set this to at least getIconWidth() so the image and label don't overlap. An alternative is to set the vertical position ( setLabelTop(int) ) high or low enough so the label gets positioned above or below the image.

Parameters:
labelHorizontalMargin -

getLabelTop

public int getLabelTop()

setLabelTop

public void setLabelTop(int labelVerticalMargin)
Vertical position of the label relative to the position of the event (left-top corner of the image).
You need to be aware that Canvas draws images and texts differently. Images get drawn below and to the right of the specified position while texts get drawn above and to the right of the position. Thus, if you want the text not to be displayed above the image you need to set the vertical position to about 60% the height of the image.

Parameters:
labelVerticalMargin -

getLabelPaint

public Paint getLabelPaint()

setLabelPaint

public void setLabelPaint(Paint labelPaint)
The paint to be used to render the text. This includes color, size and font.

Parameters:
labelPaint -
